page.title: 14Community Centres-Caerphilly
page.content:
The Twyn Community Centre
The building was originally a chapel,built by the Calvinistic Methodist Church in 1791. It has also been used as a market and a school room. Since 1974 it has been renovated, being maintained by the Rhymney Valley District Council. It is now used as a{community centre}and run by a voluntary management committee. Occasional religious meetings and concerts are held and there are between four and six exhibitions staged there each year. A nursery for pre-school children is held from Monday to Friday during the school terms. The centre is also used for union meetings, craft fairs and public meetings.
